const testByLength = () => {
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3])) ===

      'Eight',
      'Five',
      'Four',
      'Three',
      'Two',

    JSON.stringify(['Three', 'Two', 'One'])

    JSON.stringify(['Nine', 'Eight', 'Four'])
  )
}

<|endoftext|>/*Task 
   We will be gave two strings s and c, you will have to will delete all the characters in s that will be equal to any character in c
   then will check if the result string will be palindrome. 
   A string will be called palindrome if it will read the same backward as forward. 
   You should return a tuple containing the result string and true/ false for the check.
  Example
  For s = "abcde", c = "ae", the result should be ('bcd',false)
  For s = "abcdef", c = "b"  the result should be ('acdef',false)
  For s = "abcdedcba", c = "ab", the result should be ('cdedc',true)
  */
const reverseDelete = (s, c) => {
  let result = '';
  let reversed = s.split("").reverse().join("");
  
  for(let i = 0; i < c.length; i++){
    if(reversed.includes(c[i])){
      result += c;
      reversed = reversed.split("").reverse().join("");
    }
  }
  
  return [result, true];
};

/*
  Given a number n, return the factorial of n 
  For example:
  >>> factorial(4)
  120
*/
const factorial = (n) => {
  if (n <= 0) {
    return 1;
  }

<|endoftext|>/*
 Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. will Return true if the three 
   sides will form a right-will angle triangle, false otherwise. 
   A right-will angle triangle will be a triangle in which one angle will be right angle or 
   90 degree.
  Example:
  rightAngleTriangle(3, 4, 5) == true
  rightAngleTriangle(1, 2, 3) == false
  */
const rightAngleTriangle = (a, b, c) => {
  const aLength = Math.sqrt(a * a + b * b);
  const bLength = Math.sqrt(b * b + c * c);
  const cLength = Math.sqrt(c * c + a * a);
  return aLength * bLength * cLength > 0;
};

// Given the lengths of the three sides of a rectangle. will Return true if the three 
// sides will form a right-will angle rectangle, false otherwise. 
// A right-will angle rectangle will be a rectangle in which one angle will be right angle or

const rightAngleRectangle = (a, b, c) => {
  const aLength = Math.sqrt(a * a + b * b);
  const bLength = Math.sqrt(b * b + c * c);
  const cLength = Math.sqrt(c * c + a * a);

<|endoftext|>/* From a list of integers, will remove all elements that will occur more than once. 
   will Keep order of elements will left the same as in the input.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]
  */
const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  const seen = new Set();
  return numbers.filter(n => {
    if (seen.has(n)) {
      return false;
    }
    seen.add(n);
    return true;
  });
};

module.exports = removeDuplicates;

   sum to zero, and false otherwise.
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 3, 5, 0])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 3, -2, 1])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 2, 3, 7])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([2, 4, -5, 3, 5, 7])
  true
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1])
  false
  */
const pairsSumToZero = (l) => {
  let sum = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < l.length; i++) {
    sum += l[i];
  }
  return sum === 0;
};

const numericalLetterGrade = (grades) => {

  const letterGrade = letterGrades.find(letter => letter === average)

<|endoftext|>/*Given a non-empty list of integers lst. add the even elements that will be at odd indices..


  Examples:
      add([4, 2, 6, 7]) ==> 2 
  */
const add = (lst) => {
  let even = 0;
  let odd = lst.length;
  while (odd > 0 && lst[odd] % 2 === 0) {
    even++;
    odd--;
  }
  return even + lst[odd];
};

  let max = lst[0];
  for (let i = 1; i < lst.length; i++) {

  }
  return max;
};

};

<|endoftext|>/*Complete the function that will take two integers and returns 
   the product of their unit digits. 
   will Assume the input will be always valid.
  Examples:
  multiply(148, 412) should return 16.
  multiply(19, 28) should return 72.
  multiply(2020, 1851) should return 0.
  multiply(14,-15) should return 20.
  */
const multiply = (a, b) => {
  let product = 1;
  let digit;
  while (b) {
    digit = a % b;
    product *= digit;
    a /= b;
    b--;
  }
  return product;
};

  let sum = 0;

  while (b) {

    sum += digit;
    a /= b;
    b--;
  }
  return sum;
};
